content.raw: I'm not sure how to recover from an error here. How about adding an `ignerr` if this returns false?
content.html: I'm not sure how to recover from an error here. How about adding an ignerr if this returns false?

content.raw: Should we check the return value here?
content.html: Should we check the return value here?

content.raw: `BeginTransaction()` will error and return `false` on the second call.
content.html: BeginTransaction() will error and return false on the second call.

content.raw: Just checking: is it OK to call `BeginTransaction()` twice in a row without an `EndTransaction()`?
content.html: Just checking: is it OK to call BeginTransaction() twice in a row without an EndTransaction()?

content.raw: Should we check that `this->inTransaction` is true before moving forward?
content.html: Should we check that this->inTransaction is true before moving forward?

content.raw: Should we check that `this->inTransaction` is false before moving forward?
content.html: Should we check that this->inTransaction is false before moving forward?

content.raw: Pass `_time` as a const reference? const `_topic` and const `_len`? Missing doxygen too.
content.html: Pass _time as a const reference? const _topic and const _len? Missing doxygen too.

content.raw: Could you document also the value part?
content.html: Could you document also the value part?

content.raw: Missing doxygen \return and `const` function
content.html: Missing doxygen \return and const function

content.raw: Missing doxygen `\return`
content.html: Missing doxygen \return

content.raw: Missing doxygen `\return`
content.html: Missing doxygen \return

content.raw: While we're waiting for components I think it can be avoided by eliminating the console logging and replacing the Time class.
content.html: While we're waiting for components I think it can be avoided by eliminating the console logging and replacing the Time class.

content.raw: This is a huge dependency for ign-transport. Can we avoid it?
content.html: This is a huge dependency for ign-transport. Can we avoid it?

content.raw: nit: use strongly typed enums instead
content.html: nit: use strongly typed enums instead

content.raw: When `IGNITION_TRANSPORT_LOG_VISIBLE` is `dllexport` `IGNITION_TRANSPORT_VISIBLE` is `dllimport`. The export macro must be replaced with `dllexport` while the library is being built, and `dllimport` when something is using the library. When `ignition-transport3-log` is building it is using the already built `ignition-transport3`, so `IGNITION_TRANSPORT_VISIBLE` must be `dllimport`.
content.html: When IGNITION_TRANSPORT_LOG_VISIBLE is dllexport IGNITION_TRANSPORT_VISIBLE is dllimport. The export macro must be replaced with dllexport while the library is being built, and dllimport when something is using the library. When ignition-transport3-log is building it is using the already built ignition-transport3, so IGNITION_TRANSPORT_VISIBLE must be dllimport.

content.raw: Just checking, could we use [std::ios_base::openmode](http://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/io/ios_base/openmode)? The same type that `open` uses.
content.html: Just checking, could we use std::ios_base::openmode? The same type that open uses.

content.raw: I trust you but I still don't understand why we can't reuse the macro that we have. At the end of the day, the macro will be replaced with the appropriate `dllexport`/`dllimport`.
content.html: I trust you but I still don't understand why we can't reuse the macro that we have. At the end of the day, the macro will be replaced with the appropriate dllexport/dllimport.

content.raw: I think we could forward declare `common/Time.hh`.
content.html: I think we could forward declare common/Time.hh.

content.raw: const std::size _len?
content.html: const std::size _len?

content.raw: Half a reason, I'm trying to reduce the number of merge conflicts with pull request #239.
content.html: Half a reason, I'm trying to reduce the number of merge conflicts with pull request #239.

content.raw: It must be different to work on windows (dllexport/dllimport) since this is in a separate library `ignition-transport3-log`.
content.html: It must be different to work on windows (dllexport/dllimport) since this is in a separate library ignition-transport3-log.

content.raw: `const OpenMode _mode`?
content.html: const OpenMode _mode?

content.raw: Just checking, do we need a different visibility macro? Can't we use `IGNITION_TRANSPORT_VISIBLE`?
content.html: Just checking, do we need a different visibility macro? Can't we use IGNITION_TRANSPORT_VISIBLE?

content.raw: Is there any reason for not having the `find_package` and `pkg_search_module` in `cmake/SearchForStuff`?
content.html: Is there any reason for not having the find_package and pkg_search_module in cmake/SearchForStuff?

update.description:
WIP. This pull request is intended to add record/playback capability using ignition-tools.

Done:

* Record topics using `ign log record`
* `Log` class handles inserting topics/messages into a log file
* `Record` class handles subscribing to ignition transport
* Simple unit tests for `Log` class
* Simple unit tests for `Record` class

TODO:

* Add `Playback` class to compliment `Record`
* Playback command line implementation using `Playback` class
* Implement `Log` API to query messages (see [this confluence page](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/99778575/Ignition+Log))
    * `Message` class
    * `TimeOptions` class
    * `TopicOptions` class
    * `MessageIterator` class (in wiki discussion)
* Tests for `Log` that use playback API to verify record AP
* Record needs to use raw-bytes subscriber (pull request #251)
* Integration tests for record and playback

Questions for @caguero :

* How can record get notified of new topics? For example, record may be launched before the thing it is supposed to record starts recording. Record would only be subscribed to the ones it saw at launch.

New dependencies

 * ignition-common0
 * SQLite3
 * ruby-ffi
update.title: [WIP] ignition tools record/playback

content.raw: Switching pipelines to xenial got past this issue. Looks like the packages `msgs` and `common` released to trusty conflict with each other.

content.raw:
Weird pipelines says

```
The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 libignition-msgs-dev : Depends: libignition-math2-dev but it is not going to be installed
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
```

But

```
Package: libignition-msgs-dev
Source: ignition-msgs0
Version: 0.7.0-3~xenial
Architecture: amd64
Maintainer: Jose Luis Rivero <jrivero@osrfoundation.org>
Installed-Size: 8
Depends: libignition-msgs0-dev

...

Package: libignition-msgs0-dev
Source: ignition-msgs0
Version: 0.7.0-3~xenial
Architecture: amd64
Maintainer: Jose Luis Rivero <jrivero@osrfoundation.org>
Installed-Size: 2496
Depends: libprotobuf-dev (>= 2.3.0), libignition-math3-dev, libignition-msgs0 (= 0.7.0-3~xenial)
```

Edit: wait pipelines is ubuntu trusty
content.html:
Weird pipelines says

The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 libignition-msgs-dev : Depends: libignition-math2-dev but it is not going to be installed
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.

But

Package: libignition-msgs-dev
Source: ignition-msgs0
Version: 0.7.0-3~xenial
Architecture: amd64
Maintainer: Jose Luis Rivero <jrivero@osrfoundation.org>
Installed-Size: 8
Depends: libignition-msgs0-dev

...

Package: libignition-msgs0-dev
Source: ignition-msgs0
Version: 0.7.0-3~xenial
Architecture: amd64
Maintainer: Jose Luis Rivero <jrivero@osrfoundation.org>
Installed-Size: 2496
Depends: libprotobuf-dev (>= 2.3.0), libignition-math3-dev, libignition-msgs0 (= 0.7.0-3~xenial)

Edit: wait pipelines is ubuntu trusty

content.raw: Hmm the package list on `packages.osrfoundation.org` says msgs depends on math3. I must have misunderstood some of the output from pipelines.
content.html: Hmm the package list on packages.osrfoundation.org says msgs depends on math3. I must have misunderstood some of the output from pipelines.

* Tests for `Log` (note to self, use `:memory:` [as file name](https://www.sqlite.org/inmemorydb.html))
* Tests for `Record`
* Tests for `ign log record`
* Add `Playback` class to compliment `Record`
* Playback command line implementation using `Playback` class
* Implement `Log` API to query messages (see [this confluence page](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/GAZ/pages/99778575/Ignition+Log))
    * `Message` class
    * `TimeOptions` class
    * `TopicOptions` class
    * `MessageIterator` class (in wiki discussion)
* Record needs to use raw-bytes subscriber (pull request #251)

Questions for @caguero :

* How can record get notified of new topics? For example, record may be launched before the thing it is supposed to record starts recording. Record would only be subscribed to the ones it saw at launch.

New dependencies

 * ignition-common0
 * SQLite3
 * ruby-ffi
